description.narrative:
G4AW: http://g4aw.spaceoffice.nl/en/ NSO: http://www.spaceoffice.nl/en/
CROPMON aims to develop and make available an affordable information service, that provides farmers - including smallholders - with information that helps them to make improved farm management decisions during the growing season. When crop growth is non-optimal, farmers will receive alert messages based on near real-time satellite imagery.

The project focuses on farmers and their crops of coffee, maize, grass and sorghum in the southwestern part of Kenya; counties Bomet, Bungoma, Elegeyo Marakwet, Embu, Kakamega, Kericho, Kiambu, Kirinyaga, Laikipia, Machakos, Meru, Migori, Muranga, Nakuru, Nandi, Nyandarua, Nyeri, Tharaka Nithi, Trans Nzoia and Uasin Gishu. The aim of the project is to have 150,000 farmers subscribed to the CROPMON information service by the end of the project.

mailing-address.narrative: Netherlands Space Office (NSO) Prinses Beatrixlaan 2 | 2595 AL | The Hague | The Netherlands P.O. Box 93144 | 2509 AC | The Hague | The Netherlands

Positive feedback from Kenyan farmers (2018, blog)
Mobile device informing the farmer about crop condition
Sustainability and impact of the programme

description.narrative: At the end of the program an impact study will be executed to gain insight into the sustainability and impact of the entire G4AW program

title.narrative: Performed impact study: Assesment of the sustainability and impact of the program

description.narrative: At the end of the program an impact study will be executed to gain insight into the sustainability and impact of the entire G4AW program. Indicators will include: • Poverty reduction • Increased food security • Increased income security • Improved input efficiency • Sustainable water use • Increased resilience • Climate change adaptation • Gender equality • Sustainable development stakeholders • Sustainable economic growth
Number of food producers (#) with an improvement (%) as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.
Improvement (%) in food production as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.

comment.narrative: Most projects and corresponding partnerships were formed within this program, having no previous results. Furthermore, most projects need an initial technical development and gained support and commitment of involved stakeholders before any real results can be reached. As a result, most projects do not start to achieve significant results until the third year of operation.
End of programme goal: average >10% increase among all individual projects

description.narrative: Improvement (%) in income as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.

title.narrative: More effective use of inputs; water, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides

description.narrative: Improvement in effective use of water, seeds, fertilizer and pesticides as a result of using the service(s)

comment.narrative: Most projects and corresponding partnerships were formed within this program, having no previous results. Furthermore, most projects need an initial technical development and gained support and commitment of involved stakeholders before any real results can be reached. As a result, most projects do not start to achieve significant results until the third year of operation.
End of programme goal: More food producers are having access to inputs, and food producers already using inputs are using these inputs more effectively (>10% increase).

description.narrative: Total number of individual family farms having a subscription to one or multiple service(s) provided within the project. This subscription can be paid by the farmer self, or being paid for by an overaching organisation, farmer community, aggregator or government. Reach (awareness) > Service Uptake (use) > Benefit from use (impact)
